definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself

sentences.english: I rang again and a maid with a sullen face opened the door .
sentences.chinese: 我又撳了一下門鈴，一名侍女緊繃着臉把門開了。

sentences.english: As well as fragments of coffin wood and nails, there were four press studs.
sentences.chinese: 另外，除了棺木碎片和釘子以外，還有四個撳扣。

sentences.english: Why didn't you press the switch just now?
sentences.chinese: 剛纔你爲什麼不撳按鈕？

sentences.english: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
sentences.chinese: 撳響喇叭提醒其他的司機。

sentences.english: The man with the flat face and the broken nose crushed the end of the cigarette on the table.
sentences.chinese: 長着扁臉和斷鼻樑的人在桌上撳滅了菸蒂。

sentences.english: The animals learned to press switch levers with their paws.
sentences.chinese: 動物學習用它們的腳爪撳按開關。

sentences.english: And groping with one hand , she pressed the knob of an electric bell by her beds head.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，她用一隻手摸索着，撳了一下牀頭的電鈴。

definition: lever-style guillotine/to chop using this type of guillotine
to shape on a lathe/to peel with a knife/to turn in (a screw)
